{{short description|American musician}} {{Use mdy dates|date=July 2020}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Randy Montana | image = | alt = | caption = | image_size = | birth_name = Randy Schlappi | birth_place = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1985|09|23}}[http://www.umgnashville.com/artist/detail.aspx?nid=6380&aid=220 And The Bus Rolls On In The Latest Episode of Van Cam] | origin = [[Albany, New York]], U.S. | instrument = Vocals | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | occupation = Singer-songwriter | years_active = 2009{{spaced ndash}}present | label = [[Mercury Nashville]] }} '''Randy Schlappi''' (born September 23, 1985), known professionally as '''Randy Montana''', is an American [[country music|country]] singer signed to [[Mercury Records Nashville]]. His first album, ''Randy Montana'', was released in 2011. ==Early and personal life== Randy Schlappi is the son of singer-songwriter [[Billy Montana]].{{cite web |url=http://blog.gactv.com/blog/2010/02/25/sugarland-david-nail-josh-turner-a-massive-demonstration-at-the-ryman/ |title=Sugarland, David Nail, Josh Turner: a Massive Demonstration at the Ryman |author=Tom Roland |date=February 25, 2010 |work=[[Great American Country]] |accessdate=March 23, 2010}} He is married to Montgomery "Gummy" Lee, daughter of retired [[stock car racing|stock car]] racer [[Kyle Petty]], and granddaughter of [[Richard Petty]]. The couple have one daughter Sullivan Mae Montana born February 27, 2012, and one son Gunnar West Montana born December 10, 2014. ==Musical career== In March 2010, Montana released his debut single "Ain't Much Left of Lovin' You," to radio. The song entered at No. 59 on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Hot Country Songs]] charts dated for the week ending April 3, 2010. His self-titled album's second single "1,000 Faces" released to country radio on 2011. Karlie Justus of Engine 145 gave "Ain't Much Left of Lovin' You" a thumbs-up, calling Montana's voice "raspy" and comparing the song's theme to [[George Jones]]'s "[[The Grand Tour (song)|The Grand Tour]]."{{cite web |url=http://www.engine145.com/randy-montana-aint-much-left-of-lovin-you/ |title=Randy Montana — "Ain't Much Left of Lovin' You" |author=Karlie Justus |date=March 18, 2010 |work=Engine 145 |accessdate=March 23, 2010 |archive-date=December 18, 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141218080820/http://www.engine145.com/randy-montana-aint-much-left-of-lovin-you/ |url-status=dead }} Matt Bjorke of Roughstock rated it three-and-a-half stars out of five, saying that the song is a "grow-on-you type" but that it "really feels like a genuine and proper introduction."{{cite web |url=http://www.roughstock.com/blog/randy-montana-ain-t-much-left-of-lovin-you- |title=Randy Montana — "Ain't Much Left of Lovin' You" |author=Matt Bjorke |date=March 23, 2010 |work=Roughstock |accessdate=March 23, 2010 |archive-date=June 13, 2011 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110613154347/http://www.roughstock.com/blog/randy-montana-ain-t-much-left-of-lovin-you- |url-status=dead }} ===Concert Tours=== *'''Own The Night Tour ''' with [[Lady Antebellum]] (2011) ==Discography== ===Studio albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2" style="width:10em;"| Title ! rowspan="2" style="width:18em;"| Details ! colspan="2"| Peak chart
